Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "`AndroidSdkBuildToolsVersion` is not exported in binding projects" (#2452) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Looks like the msbuild property `AndroidSdkBuildToolsVersion` is not being exported in binding projects.

Here's a binlog with an example of it:

[binlog.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2605457/binlog.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to mono/mono/2018-06@b63e5378" (#2449) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
$ git diff --shortstat 709b46e3..b63e5378
	 14 files changed, 138 insertions(+), 77 deletions(-)

Various fixes, primarily for iOS.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VS2017 can not build xamarin android project if it has BuildNativeLibs target" (#2451) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I have a project which has additional pre-build step for building native android library by using ndk-build.

I want to add a dependency on "AndroidPrepareForBuild" target to check that all sdk paths have been resolved correctly before ndk-build call.

`
  <Target Name="BuildNativeLibs" DependsOnTargets="AndroidPrepareForBuild" Inputs="jni\Android.mk;jni\Application.mk" Outputs="@(AndroidNativeLibrary)">
    <Exec Command="$(AndroidNdkDirectory)\ndk-build -C jni" />
  </Target>
`

But after that VS can not build my project with some errors with resources:

`
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(7): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'icon' with value '@mipmap/ic_launcher').
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(7): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'label' with value '@string/app_name').
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(7): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'roundIcon' with value '@mipmap/ic_launcher_round').
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(7): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'theme' with value '@style/AppTheme').
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(8): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'label' with value '@string/app_name').
1>NdkExample\NdkExample\obj\Debug\81\android\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml(8): error APT0000: No resource found that matches the given name (at 'theme' with value '@style/AppTheme.NoActionBar').
`

Seems like I have some conflict with some another target which used for preparing resources.

NdkExample.zip attached.

### Note

This error can be avoided if move BuildNativeLibs target to separated Android binding project and use EmbeddedNativeLibrary instead of AndroidNativeLibrary

[NdkExample.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/2603403/NdkExample.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[xa-prep-tasks] use JdkInfo to find JavaSdkDirectory" (#2436) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
On Windows, if you have Microsoft OpenJDK installed, you currently
needed a `Configuration.Override.props` such as:

    <Project>
      <PropertyGroup>
        <JavaSdkDirectory>C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.8.0_161</JavaSdkDirectory>
      </PropertyGroup>
    </Project>

The Xamarin.Android build can't currently work with Microsoft OpenJDK,
because it is missing header files.

I've updated the `JdkInfo` MSBuild task to match a similar task in
Java.Interop. It now validates that JDKs are < `$(MaxJdkVersion)`, and
contain valid header files. `$(MaxJdkVersion)` defaults to 8.0 if it
is blank.

Now I am able to build Xamarin.Android on a Windows machine with
multiple JDKs and it picks the correct one.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[mono-runtimes] Update @(MonoFacadeAssembly)" (#2450) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/1879

Add the following Facade assemblies to `@(MonoFacadeAssembly)`:

  * `System.Buffers.dll`
  * `System.Memory.dll`
  * `System.Net.Http.Rtc.dll`
  * `System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions.dll`

Note: list was reordered to be sorted as per **sort**(1), and
generated with the following shell code on macOS:

	$ cd external/mono/mcs/class/Facades
	$ for d in `find . -depth 1 -type d | grep -v 'netstandard\|System.Drawing.Primitives' | sort -f` ; do
	  n=`basename "$d"`;
	  echo "    <MonoFacadeAssembly Include=\"$n.dll\" />";
	done | pbcopy

The `netstandard` and `System.Drawing.Primitives` directory are
excluded so that the comment and following `@(MonoFacadeAssembly)`
entries in `ProfileAssemblies.projitems` are still relevant.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump to mono/mono/2018-06@b63e5378" (#2449) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
$ git diff --shortstat 709b46e3..b63e5378
	 14 files changed, 138 insertions(+), 77 deletions(-)

Various fixes, primarily for iOS.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[mono-sdks] <DownloadUri/> should not run during design-time builds" (#2439) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2350

Most of the logic in `mono-runtimes.csproj` was happening during
`CoreCompile`. The problem with this is that design-time builds in
Visual Studio runs `CoreCompile`. The `Task.Wait` in `<DownloadUri/>`
causes a hang.

It turns out we could just completely remove the following target:

    <Target Name="CoreCompile"
        DependsOnTargets="_Build">
    </Target>

`_Build` still runs appropriately. `_BuildUnlessCached` will call
`ForceBuild` or `_Build` depending if things are cached.

  at Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject.SetValueActual (Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty property, Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject+BindablePropertyContext context, System.Object value, System.Boolean currentlyApplying, Xamarin.Forms.Internals.SetValueFlags attributes, System.Boolean silent) [0x0012a] in <3a9c335d80a748a29a8f8588acbed83f>:0 
  at Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject.SetValueCore (Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty property, System.Object value, Xamarin.Forms.Internals.SetValueFlags attributes, Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject+SetValuePrivateFlags privateAttributes) [0x0015b] in <3a9c335d80a748a29a8f8588acbed83f>:0 
  at Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject.SetValueCore (Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty property, System.Object value, Xamarin.Forms.Internals.SetValueFlags attributes) [0x00000] in <3a9c335d80a748a29a8f8588acbed83f>:0 
  at Xamarin.Forms.ListView.NotifyRowTapped (System.Int32 groupIndex, System.Int32 inGroupIndex, Xamarin.Forms.Cell cell) [0x0005e] in <3a9c335d80a748a29a8f8588acbed83f>:0 
  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.iOS.ListViewRenderer+ListViewDataSource.RowSelected (UIKit.UITableView tableView, Foundation.NSIndexPath indexPath) [0x0006f] in <66855f87e3b64ff38a3e1034f86d8129>:0 
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) UIKit.UIApplication.UIApplicationMain(int,string[],intptr,intptr)
  at UIKit.UIApplication.Main (System.String[] args, System.IntPtr principal, System.IntPtr delegate) [0x00005] in <4ab8db046af64ab0ae036378dae8bfd3>:0 
  at UIKit.UIApplication.Main (System.String[] args, System.String principalClassName, System.String delegateClassName) [0x0002c] in <4ab8db046af64ab0ae036378dae8bfd3>:0 
  at Client.iOS.Application.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <5b29b4e1208f41ebbd77b10ed7c6ca37>:0 `

**Thanks for helping with/fixing this!**

Cheers 
Philipp

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Objectdisposed crash when closing app in release build" (#3489) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Lately, we have an app that crashes every time the app is closed (swiped away) in android. The issue ONLY occurs on release builds. On debug builds the app works fine. The exception stacktrace (caught by appcenter) is:

JniPeerMembers.AssertSelf (Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable self)
System.ObjectDisposedException: Cannot access a disposed object. Object name: 'Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.AppCompat.MasterDetailPageRenderer'.
JniPeerMembers.AssertSelf (Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable self)
JniPeerMembers+JniInstanceMethods.InvokeVirtualVoidMethod (System.String encodedMember, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable self, Java.Interop.JniArgumentValue* parameters)
DrawerLayout.RemoveDrawerListener (Android.Support.V4.Widget.DrawerLayout+IDrawerListener listener)
NavigationPageRenderer.Dispose (System.Boolean disposing)
Object.Dispose ()
Platform.SetPageInternal (Xamarin.Forms.Page newRoot)

This is a very pressing issue for us, since we are unable to release an update for our app when the app crashes (almost) every time it is closed.

### Steps to Reproduce
We cannot seem to reproduce it in a small app. I seems to happen to 1 of our 3 apps. Even though there is major code sharing between them.

### Expected Behavior
App doesn't crash on close

### Actual Behavior
App crashes on close

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version: don't know. Reverted back until 3.0.482510 but app still crashed.
- IDE: Visual studio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: 8.1 (27)
- Android Support Library Version: 27.0.2.1
- Nuget Packages: Lots.
- Affected Devices: Tested on LG Nexus 5X

### Reproduction Link
We are unable to create a small reproduction. It seems be a race condition in our app that isn't present in a small demo app. We're trying to discover a point in time in our history where the error started occurring, which might give us a clue as to what is the trigger for this issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NavigationPage modifies StatusBar text color so you cannot define NavigationBar text color and statusbar text color seperately" (#3888) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
I have an enterance xaml "WelcomePage" to welcome end user in my xamarin forms app.
Background is a blurred image so there is no navigation bar and statusbar text color must be white because of the colors...
When i set the statusbar color with the classical approach (View-controller based setting > NO and setStatusBarStyle blabla...) it works. But if i push the WelcomePage embedded in a NavigationPage, it makes the statusbar text color black. If i set BarTextColor to white. I solves but i ruins the next pushed page bartextcolor because next page's bar is white. So text is white, background is white... white empty bar problem... I tried to set pushed page's BarTextColor to black in OnAppearing but Statusbar changes too...
This statusbar text change behavior is not a good approach i think... can you find a way to set them seperately. Maybe extra properties to set statusbar background and text colors...

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ListView crash: NSInternalInconsistencyException Reason: Attempt to create two animations for cell" (#3917) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Sometimes when navigating to a page, app crashes when resetting the ItemsSource on a ListView. The source is an "unconventional" use of a ObservableCollection. 

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create ViewModel with ObservableCollection with items
2. Let Page listen to ViewModel changes in OnPropertyChanged 
3. Reset the ItemsSource in OnPropertyChanged
4. ListView crashes because it tries to create two "Delete" animations for same rows, perhaps a race condition, on line 560 of the ListViewRenderer.
[stacktrace.txt](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2423952/stacktrace.txt)


### Expected Behavior

### Actual Behavior

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.2.0
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VS18.5.1
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  11.14.0.14
  - Android: <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP:  <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 --> 
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "iOS PullToRefresh not working within PreferLargeTitles within Navigation Page and Tabbed Page" (#3829) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
ListView PullToRefresh does not work within a Tabbed Page > Navigation Page > Content Page running on iOS with the NavigationPage.PrefersLargeTitles set to true.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run Sample App on iOS
2. Try to Pull to Refresh on the tab, and it doesn't work

### Expected Behavior
Pull to Refresh works, like it does when not using the PreferLargeTitles
### Actual Behavior
Pull to refresh does not work
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.2.0.839982
- Last known good version: Unknown
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 version 15.8.4
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  11.4
- Nuget Packages: -
- Affected Devices: -

### Screenshots

N/A

### Reproduction Link

Added sample project.
[TabbedPageWithNavigationPage.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2396437/TabbedPageWithNavigationPage.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Native renderer is not found from my custom control for Xamarin Forms iOS" (#4031) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Description

I have created a custom control in Xamarin forms and its native control set as custom control which inherits from UITextField, when I tried to get native renderer form my custom control using **Platform.CreateRenderer(myCustomControl)**, default renderer is obtained and native renderer is not found for Xamarin Forms iOS. Kindly refer the screenshots below,

**Image_1**
![Image_1](https://i.postimg.cc/63pWBv2V/Screen_Shot_2018-10-08_at_10.44.47_AM.png)

**Image_2**
![Image_2](https://i.postimg.cc/HxmgL7rv/Screen_Shot_2018-10-08_at_11.28.52_AM.png)

For Xamarin Forms Android, native renderer is obtained properly from my custom control using sample code , Kindly refer the screenshot below,

**Image_3**
![Image_3](https://i.postimg.cc/J7PG9RgC/Screen_Shot_2018-10-08_at_11.36.30_AM.png)

**Note:** I have passed forms and native view in ViewRenderer for Xamarin Forms iOS renderer. kindly refer the code snippet below,

Code snippet:
public class MyCustomControl : ViewRenderer<View, UITextField>
{
}

Could you please share in which scenario default renderer will be obtained? 
Also, could you please suggest how to get native renderer in this scenario and from default renderer? 

Regards,
Ganeshamoorthy C
